page.title: 07County and District Councils
page.content: Here as elsewhere local government is carried on at three separate levels: county council, district council and - the most local - parish council. For county council elections, counties are split into electoral divisions and elections are held every fourth year - 1985, 1989, etc., with all councillors retiring. All of the block is in the county of Hereford and Worcester, and most of it in the electoral division of Dinmore. For district council elections, the electoral unit is the ward. For each of 3 years running, a third of the district councillors retire and elections are held in those wards. In the fourth year, when county council elections are held, there are no district council elections. (continued on page 8)
